This file simulates the hardware responsible for retiring instructions.

<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class tracks which instructions are in-flight (i.e., dispatched but not</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="comment">/// retired) in the OoO backend.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This class checks on every cycle if/which instructions can be retired.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Instructions are retired in program order.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment">/// In the event of an instruction being retired, the pipeline that owns</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment">/// this RetireControlUnit (RCU) gets notified.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="comment">/// On instruction retired, register updates are all architecturally</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="comment">/// committed, and any physicall registers previously allocated for the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="comment">/// retired instruction are freed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/mca/retirecontrolunit"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/mca/retirecontrolunit/#a90de9bdaf1a6c428ea958a2850bdc6a9">RetireControlUnit</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> HardwareUnit &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A RUToken is created by the RCU for every instruction dispatched to the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// schedulers.  These &quot;tokens&quot; are managed by the RCU in its token Queue.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// On every cycle (&#39;cycleEvent&#39;), the RCU iterates through the token queue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// looking for any token with its &#39;Executed&#39; flag set.  If a token has that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// flag set, then the instruction has reached the write-back stage and will</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// be retired by the RCU.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#39;NumSlots&#39; represents the number of entries consumed by the instruction in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the reorder buffer. Those entries will become available again once the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instruction is retired.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note that the size of the reorder buffer is defined by the scheduling</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// model via field &#39;NumMicroOpBufferSize&#39;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/mca/retirecontrolunit/rutoken"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/mca/retirecontrolunit/rutoken">RUToken</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/mca/retirecontrolunit/rutoken/#a082a604d529a20e0c27cca3ccff88686"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instref">InstRef</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/mca/retirecontrolunit/rutoken/#a082a604d529a20e0c27cca3ccff88686">IR</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/mca/retirecontrolunit/rutoken/#a3f776b0f155d7da8044a7fd88f83515f"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/mca/retirecontrolunit/rutoken/#a3f776b0f155d7da8044a7fd88f83515f">NumSlots</a>; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Slots reserved to this instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/mca/retirecontrolunit/rutoken/#a416015919b2e463d01b7483253f02dca"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/mca/retirecontrolunit/rutoken/#a416015919b2e463d01b7483253f02dca">Executed</a>;     </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// True if the instruction is past the WB stage.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::vector&lt;RUToken&gt; Queue;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> normalizeQuantity(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Quantity)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Some instructions may declare a number of uOps which exceeds the size</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of the reorder buffer. To avoid problems, cap the amount of slots to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the size of the reorder buffer.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="normal">    Quantity = std::min(Quantity, NumROBEntries);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Further normalize the number of micro opcodes for instructions that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// declare zero opcodes. This should match the behavior of method</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// reserveSlot().</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::max(Quantity, 1U);</Highlight></CodeLine>
